elements.title: HIV immune evasin Nef enhances allogeneic CAR T cell potency
elements.contents:
HIV immune evasin Nef enhances allogeneic CAR T cell potency

  • Karlo Perica
  • Ivan Kotchetkov
  • Michel Sadelain
Article30 Jan 2025

elements.title: Molecular basis of vitamin K driven γ-carboxylation at membrane interface
elements.contents:
Molecular basis of vitamin K driven γ-carboxylation at membrane interface

  • Qing Cao
  • Aaron Ammerman
  • Weikai Li
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Engineered heart muscle allografts for heart repair in primates and humans
elements.contents:
Engineered heart muscle allografts for heart repair in primates and humans

Epicardial engineered heart muscle allografts from induced pluripotent stem cell-derived cardiomyocytes can safely and effectively remuscularize chronically failing hearts in rhesus macaques, leading to improved cardiac function and paving the way for human clinical trials.

  • Ahmad-Fawad Jebran
  • Tim Seidler
  • Wolfram-Hubertus Zimmermann
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Methanol transfer supports metabolic syntrophy between bacteria and archaea
elements.contents:
Methanol transfer supports metabolic syntrophy between bacteria and archaea

Zhaonella formicivorans produces methanol, for a novel syntrophic interaction, without requiring methylated compounds as an input.

  • Yan Huang
  • Kensuke Igarashi
  • Masaru K. Nobu
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: SARS-CoV-2 evolution on a dynamic immune landscape
elements.contents:
SARS-CoV-2 evolution on a dynamic immune landscape

A modelling approach predicts SARS-CoV-2 variant dynamics on the basis of immunity and cross-neutralization, which was shaped by a region’s SARS-CoV-2 infection history.

  • N. Alexia Raharinirina
  • Nils Gubela
  • Max von Kleist
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Structure and mechanism of vitamin-K-dependent γ-glutamyl carboxylase
elements.contents:
Structure and mechanism of vitamin-K-dependent γ-glutamyl carboxylase

Structural and cellular assays and molecular dynamics simulations reveal the mechanism of action of γ-glutamyl carboxylase, which involves cholesterol and vitamin K.

  • Rong Wang
  • Baozhi Chen
  • Xiaofeng Qi
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Warming and cooling catalyse widespread temporal turnover in biodiversity
elements.contents:
Warming and cooling catalyse widespread temporal turnover in biodiversity

Global-scale analyses of marine, terrestrial and freshwater assemblages found that temporal rates of species replacement were faster in locations with faster temperature change, including warming and cooling, and vulnerable assemblages were especially responsive.

  • Malin L. Pinsky
  • Helmut Hillebrand
  • Shane A. Blowes
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: C-terminal amides mark proteins for degradation via SCF–FBXO31
elements.contents:
C-terminal amides mark proteins for degradation via SCF–FBXO31

SCF–FBXO31 scans proteins for C-terminal amidation and marks them for subsequent proteasomal degradation.

  • Matthias F. Muhar
  • Jakob Farnung
  • Jacob E. Corn
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Copper-dependent halogenase catalyses unactivated C−H bond functionalization
elements.contents:
Copper-dependent halogenase catalyses unactivated C−H bond functionalization

A halogenase enzyme uses the copper in its active site to catalyse iterative chlorinations on multiple unactivated carbon−hydrogen bonds, enabling carbon−hydrogen functionalization that is not achievable with an iron-based halogenase.

  • Chen-Yu Chiang
  • Masao Ohashi
  • Yi Tang
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Signatures of longitudinal spin pumping in a magnetic phase transition
elements.contents:
Signatures of longitudinal spin pumping in a magnetic phase transition

Longitudinal spin pumping is experimentally demonstrated using the magnetic phase transition of iron–rhodium, and the observed inverse spin Hall signal indicates that longitudinal spin pumping is driven by quantum fluctuations.

  • Taekhyeon Lee
  • Min Tae Park
  • Kyung-Jin Lee
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Degradable thermosets via orthogonal polymerizations of a single monomer
elements.contents:
Degradable thermosets via orthogonal polymerizations of a single monomer

Degradable thermoset multimaterials can be synthesized from a commercially accessible, biosourced monomer using orthogonal polymerizations in a single pot; after selective degredation, the resulting small molecules can be repolymerized.

  • Reagan J. Dreiling
  • Kathleen Huynh
  • Brett P. Fors
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Maize monoculture supported pre-Columbian urbanism in southwestern Amazonia
elements.contents:
Maize monoculture supported pre-Columbian urbanism in southwestern Amazonia

Remote sensing, field survey and microbotanical analyses show that the pre-Columbian Casarabe culture in the Bolivian Amazon invested heavily in landscape engineering, constructing a complex system of drainage canals and newly documented savannah farm ponds.

  • Umberto Lombardo
  • Lautaro Hilbert
  • Francis Mayle
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Contrasting drought sensitivity of Eurasian and North American grasslands
elements.contents:
Contrasting drought sensitivity of Eurasian and North American grasslands

Eurasian grasslands have high production sensitivity to extreme drought compared with North American grasslands.

  • Qiang Yu
  • Chong Xu
  • Xingguo Han
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Bat genomes illuminate adaptations to viral tolerance and disease resistance
elements.contents:
Bat genomes illuminate adaptations to viral tolerance and disease resistance

A systematic analysis of 115 mammalian genomes, including 10 new bat genomes, reveals prevalent positive selection in immune genes in bats and shows key adaptations in the antiviral gene ISG15 that aid disease resistance in bats, including to coronaviruses.

  • Ariadna E. Morales
  • Yue Dong
  • Michael Hiller
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Expanding the human gut microbiome atlas of Africa
elements.contents:
Expanding the human gut microbiome atlas of Africa

A cross-sectional study from four African countries shows the importance of investigating the gut microbiome in previously under-represented populations and provides a framework for equitable microbiome research.

  • Dylan G. Maghini
  • Ovokeraye H. Oduaran
  • Scott Hazelhurst
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: An evaporite sequence from ancient brine recorded in Bennu samples
elements.contents:
An evaporite sequence from ancient brine recorded in Bennu samples

Samples from the asteroid (101955) Bennu, returned by the OSIRIS-REx mission, include sodium-bearing phosphates and sodium-rich carbonates, sulfates, chlorides and fluorides formed during evaporation of a late-stage brine.

  • T. J. McCoy
  • S. S. Russell
  • D. S. Lauretta
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: The Ronne Ice Shelf survived the last interglacial
elements.contents:
The Ronne Ice Shelf survived the last interglacial

Sea salt data from an ice core record show that Antarctica’s Ronne Ice Shelf survived the last interglacial, the last period of enhanced and sustained global warmth about 125,000 years ago.

  • Eric W. Wolff
  • Robert Mulvaney
  • Nicholas R. Golledge
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025

elements.title: CARD domains mediate anti-phage defence in bacterial gasdermin systems
elements.contents:
CARD domains mediate anti-phage defence in bacterial gasdermin systems

Caspase recruitment domains (CARDs) are present in defence systems that protect bacteria against phage, where the bacterial CARD domain is essential for protease-mediated activation of bacterial gasdermins that promote cell death.

  • Tanita Wein
  • Adi Millman
  • Rotem Sorek
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Fine-tuning gibberellin improves rice alkali–thermal tolerance and yield
elements.contents:
Fine-tuning gibberellin improves rice alkali–thermal tolerance and yield

Precise regulation of the phytohormone gibberellin to optimal levels may not only confer alkali–thermal tolerance to Green Revolution rice varieties but may also further enhance their yield, and ATT2, by enabling the fine-tuning of gibberellins, is expected to be a potential new post-Green Revolution gene.

  • Shuang-Qin Guo
  • Ya-Xin Chen
  • Youshun Lin
Article29 Jan 2025

elements.title: Global meta-analysis shows action is needed to halt genetic diversity loss
elements.contents:
Global meta-analysis shows action is needed to halt genetic diversity loss

A comprehensive meta-analysis of global terrestrial and marine genetic diversity covering more than three decades of research demonstrates rapid loss of genetic diversity and identifies conservation interventions that could mitigate this process.

  • Robyn E. Shaw
  • Katherine A. Farquharson
  • Catherine E. Grueber
ArticleOpen Access29 Jan 2025
